articles.author: James Devitt
articles.title: Anthropologists map Neanderthals' long and winding roads across Europe and Eurasia - Phys.org
articles.description: Recent scholarship has concluded that Neanderthals made a second major migration from Eastern Europe to Central and Eastern Eurasia between 120,000 and 60,000 years ago. But the routes they took have long been a mystery—primarily because there are few archaeo…
